original:
Relying solely on morphological data to distinguish species can present challenges. Characteristics that appear to define two distinct species morphologically may, upon DNA analysis, reveal that they are, in fact, a single species. This discrepancy underscores the importance of integrating genetic analysis with morphological studies.

To further explore the significance of morphological differences, researchers employ allometric enginee
